main event: Two bright white objects were observed flying over the east side of a hangar at Washington National Airport in Washington, D.C. on May 12, 1954.
interesting points: The objects were described as round, 12-15 feet in diameter, and flying in formation.
The objects disappeared over the horizon, moved rapidly at different angles, and were visible for a maximum of 45 seconds.
The objects were first observed as a very bright white light over the horizon, then flew in a straight path before turning at 90-degree angles and gradually fading out of sight.
The observation was made by three Air Force airmen from the 1325th Air Police Squadron.
A similar sighting of an unidentified object was reported over Washington National Airport on May 25, 1954.
witnesses: three Air Force airmen from the 1325th Air Police Squadron
